abstract.text: Secure personal data, and respect user preferences for how data is used.

Porting Your macOS Apps to Apple Silicon.title: Porting Your macOS Apps to Apple Silicon

abstract.text: Create a version of your macOS app that runs on both Apple silicon and Intel-based Mac computers.

Supporting Continuity Camera in Your Mac.title: Supporting Continuity Camera in Your Mac App

abstract.text: Incorporate scanned documents and pictures taken with a user's iPhone, iPad, or iPod touch into your Mac app using Continuity Camera.
Supply image resources appropriate for light and dark appearances and for high-contrast environments.

Supporting Dark Mode in Your Interface.title: Supporting Dark Mode in Your Interface

abstract.text: Update colors, images, and behaviors so that your app adapts automatically when Dark Mode is active.

Choosing a Specific Appearance for Your.title: Choosing a Specific Appearance for Your macOS App

abstract.text: Adopt a specific appearance for your windows, views, or app when it is inappropriate to support both light and dark variants.

Choosing a Specific Interface Style for.title: Choosing a Specific Interface Style for Your iOS App

abstract.text: Adopt a specific interface style for your views, view controllers, or app when it is inappropriate to support both light and dark variants.

Configuring and Displaying Symbol Images.title: Configuring and Displaying Symbol Images in Your UI

abstract.text: Create scalable images that integrate with your app’s text, and adjust the appearance of those images dynamically.
